AcRec:AcademicAwardType.description: Academic awards, degrees, diplomas, certifications, etc.

AcademicAwardDate.description: The date on which the academic award was conferred.

AcademicAwardLevel.description: The level of the degree, certificate, or award granted for the successful completion of requirements of an academic program.

items.description: Information related to the specific area of study (e.g., major) under which the award was granted.

AcademicAwardTitle.description: The descriptive title for the academic award.

AcademicCompletionDate.description: The date on which the student's requirements for the degree or diploma were met or completed.

AcademicCompletionIndicator.description: An indication that the degree-seeking student completed all of the requirements for his or her academic program.  Not used for Non-Degree programs.

items.description: Thesis or dissertation information if required for the award.
Honors information for the academic award.
Academic summary information pertaining to the award or diploma.
Additional information about the academic award

AcRec:AcademicProgramType.description: Indicates whether the academic program is a major, minor, area of concentration or specialization.

AcademicProgramName.description: Literal name of program, major, or field of study.

AcademicProgramType.description: Indicates whether the academic program is a major, minor, area of concentration or specialization.

items.description: Additional information about the Academic Program

ProgramCIPCode.description: Code indicating a discipline or field of study assigned by the Classification of Instructional Programs for Postsecondary Institutions

ProgramCSISCode.description: Code indicating a discipline or field of study assigned by Statistics Canada Canadian College Student Information System

ProgramESISCode.description: Code indicating a discipline or field of study assigned by the Statistics Canada Enhanced Student Information System.

ProgramHEGISCode.description: Code indicating a discipline or field of study assigned by Higher Education General Information Survey

ProgramLocalCode.description: This is a code typically created and used within a school or school district

ProgramSecondarySchoolCode.description: Code indicating the type of secondary school program or award that a student is pursuing

ProgramSummary.description: Summary information about the Academic Program for an Academic Session

ProgramUSISCode.description: Code indicating a discipline or field of study assigned by the Statistics Canada University Student Information System.

UserDefinedExtensions.description: A mini schema containing formatted data

AcRec:AcademicRecordType.description: Information concerning the academic achievement or status of the student.

items.description: Academic awards, degrees, diplomas, certifications, etc.
Course, award and summary information related to a specific time period.  Typically arranged into successive semesters or school years and is the preferred method for conveying academic coursework.
Used to send summary totals for all work taken at a certain academic level
Achievements not tied to a specific course, session or award.

CohortGraduationYear.description: The school year in which the student entered the baseline group used for computing completion rates, e.g., high school year and program.

items.description: Academic coursework not related to a specific academic session.
Additional information about the academic record

StudentLevel.description: Used to indicate the grade level of the student at the time the transcript is being sent, or the last grade level of the student.

UserDefinedExtensions.description: Additional structured information. Requires mutually defined XML schema.

AcRec:AcademicSessionType.description: Course, award and summary information related to a specific time period.  Typically arranged into successive semesters or school years and is the preferred method for conveying academic coursework.

items.description: Academic awards associated with this session
The major or degree objectives for the student at the time of this session

AcademicSessionDetail.description: Information identifying the time period  for the beginning of this session

items.description: Academic summary for this session

AttendanceCount.description: Attendance recorded as days (or partial days) present or absent

items.description: Education courses associated with this session
Information about  a learning experience
Additional information about the academic session

StudentLevel.description: An indication of the classification of the student at the time of this Academic Session

UserDefinedExtensions.description: This is a mini schema of previously agreed upon formatted data about the session.  It is used by a group of previously agreed upon users, frequently within a state or among the users of a particular vendor

AcRec:AcademicSummaryBaseType.description: Base type, only used as extension base

items.description: Honors information for the academic award.

AcademicSummaryLevel.description: The level of credit associated with the credit hours earned for the course.

AcademicSummaryType.description: Summary Type is an indication of what is being summarized over which period of time.

ClassRank.description: The student's class rank relative to other students in their academic cohort (e.g. class).

ClassSize.description: The numeric size of the academic cohort (e.g. class).

HighSchoolCreditSummary.description: This is a summary of credits taken at a secondary school

items.description: Additional information about academic record

ClassRank.description: The student's class rank relative to other students in their academic cohort (e.g. class).

AcademicSummaryType.description: Summary Type is an indication of what is being summarized over which period of time.

ClassRank.description: The student's class rank relative to other students in their academic cohort (e.g. class).

ClassSize.description: The numeric size of the academic cohort (e.g. class).

items.description: The academic standing of the student upon transfer to the institution

AcRec:AcademicSummaryFType.description: Full type, used in AcademicSessionType and TransferCreditType

items.description: Honors information for the academic award.

AcademicProgram.description: Academic Program(s) related to this Academic Summary

AcademicSummaryLevel.description: The level of credit associated with the credit hours earned for the course.

AcademicSummaryType.description: Summary Type is an indication of what is being summarized over which period of time.

ClassRank.description: The student's class rank relative to other students in their academic cohort (e.g. class).

ClassRankDate.description: The date on which the student was included in the class ranking and the class was ranked

ClassRankSessionCount.description: The number of sessions of coursework included in the ranking of the student in the class

ClassRankYear.description: The year on which the student was included in the class ranking and the class was ranked

ClassRankYearMonth.description: The year and month in which the student was included in the class ranking and the class was ranked

ClassSize.description: The numeric size of the academic cohort (e.g. class).

items.description: The academic standing of the student upon transfer to the institution

EntryDate.description: The date on which the student officially was admitted to the school or when the student first attended the school.

ExitDate.description: The date on which the student officially withdrew, was withdrawn, or graduated.

ExitReasonCode.description: The reason the student stopped attending.  It is a code set approved by the US Department of Education's National Center for Education Statistics and is included in the NCES Handbook.

HighSchoolCreditSummary.description: This is a summary of credits taken at a secondary school

items.description: Additional information about academic record

AcRec:AddressType.description: This is a combined Address Group for a choice between Domestic or International

items.description: Local delivery information such as street, building number, PO box, or apartment portion of a postal address of a Contact at the Sending (Source) High School.
The individual or office name within the postal address where inquiries should be directed.

City.description: The city portion of the Address of a Contact at the Sending (Source) High School.

CountryCode.description: Code indicating Country. Use ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 standard.

EffectiveDate.description: This the date when this address for the sending high school did or will become effective.

ExpirationDate.description: This the date when this address for the sending high school will no longer be valid.

items.description: Additional information about the addresses of the contacts at the source  school

PostalCode.description: The postal code portion of the Address.

StateProvince.description: The literal name of the state, province or territory of a postal address of the source of this document. Use for addresses outside US or Canada.

StateProvinceCode.description: Code for US states, etc., and Canadian provinces.

AcRec:ContactsType.description: To identify a person or an office at the sending school  to which administrative communications should be directed

items.description: This is a combined Address Group for a choice between Domestic or International
Email address of source institution contact
Fax phone number of source institution contact
Additional information about the contacts at the source institution
Phone number of source institution contact
The Uniform Resource Locator of source institution

AcRec:CourseSupplementalAcademicGradeTyp.description: Grades that are reported, which combine to make the final grade in a course.

items.description: Information in the child data element CourseSupplementalGrade about the inclusion of component parts of a grade in a course.

AcRec:CourseSupplementalGradeType.description: Information in the child data element CourseSupplementalGrade about the inclusion of component parts of a grade in a course.

CourseAcademicSupplementalGrade.description: The academic grade reported for this component or supplemental course

CourseAcademicSupplementalGradeScaleCode.description: The grading scale used by an academic educational institution for an academic course.

CourseAcademicSupplementalGradeStatusCod.description: Special enrollment or completion status of this course

items.description: Additional information about the Course Supplemental Grade

SupplementalGradeCode.description: The type of component grade that is being included for an education course

SupplementalGradeSubSession.description: This is the numeric count of the subsession of a course.  The earliest subsession would have the value of "1".  The next would be "2", etc.  Each would be a positive whole number.

AcRec:CourseType.description: Academic coursework not related to a specific academic session.

AgencyCourseID.description: The course ID that might have been assigned to this course by the state or other agency

items.description: Attributes of this course which may require special handling by the receiving institution

ClassSize.description: The number of enrollments in a specific class to be used as a benchmark for the average grade reported for a Course element

CourseAcademicGrade.description: The final grade awarded for participation in the course.

CourseAcademicGradeScaleCode.description: The grading scale used by an academic educational institution for an academic course.

CourseAcademicGradeStatusCode.description: Special enrollment or completion status of this course

CourseAddDate.description: The date a student was added to an academic course at a school.

CourseApplicability.description: The academic program to which this academic course applies toward graduation.

CourseAverageGrade.description: The calculated average grade earned by all enrolled in a given course. This grade is calculated on the same scale as CourseAcademicGrade.

CourseBeginDate.description: The official begin date for this course

CourseCIPCode.description: The Classification of Instructional Programs (CIP) code to describe the area of study for the course.

CourseCSISCode.description: The Statistics Canada Canadian College Student Information System (CCSIS) code to describe the area of study for the course.

CourseCreditBasis.description: The type of enrollment associated with the credit hours for the course.

CourseCreditEarned.description: The number of credits a student earned by the successful completion of a course.

CourseCreditLevel.description: The level of credit associated with the credit hours earned for the course.

CourseCreditUnits.description: The type of credit (unit, semester, or quarter) associated with the credit hours earned for the course.

CourseCreditValue.description: Number indicating the credit hours that may be earned in the course.

CourseDropDate.description: The date on which the student drops or withdraws from the course.

CourseEndDate.description: The official end date for this course

items.description: The alternate grade including the grade and its scale

CourseFiveDigitSCEDCode.description: This set of code values is derived from the first five digits of the CourseSCEDCode above.

CourseGPAApplicabilityCode.description: An indicator of whether or not this course being described is included in the computation of the student's Grade Point Average, and if so, if it weighted differently from regular courses.

CourseInstructionMethod.description: The method of instruction used for the course

CourseInstructionSite.description: An indication of the type of location at which the course is taught.

CourseInstructionSiteName.description: The name of the location at which the course is taught.

items.description: Course instructor title and name

CourseLevel.description: The level of work demonstrated by successful completion of  the academic course being described

CourseNCESCode.description: The code set developed (or being developed) by the United States Department of Education's National Center for Education Statistics for the Classification of Secondary School Courses

CourseNarrativeExplanationGrade.description: The narrative of the grade awarded to a student in an academic course in those cases where a course does not receive a letter or numeric grade included in the grading scale of the Course Academic Grade Qualifier.

CourseNumber.description: The official reference number portion of a course identifier. This number frequently designates the level of the course as well as the level of the student expected to enroll in the course

CourseOverrideSchool.description: The school where the credit was earned if different from the Academic Session School

CourseQualityPointsEarned.description: The numerical value assigned to a letter grade to provide a basis of quantitative determination of an average.

CourseRepeatCode.description: Indicates that an academic course has been repeated by a student and how that repeat is to be computed in the student's academic grade average.

CourseSCEDCode.description: The School Codes for the Exchange of Data (SCED) code set being developed for the United States Department of Education's National Center for Education Statistics to describe the content and level of a course

CourseSectionNumber.description: The number assigned to differentiate among distinct occurrences of courses that have the same course abbreviation and number but may be considered to be different .  For example, it could be used to identify the instructor.

CourseSubjectAbbreviation.description: The alphabetic abbreviation of the academic department or discipline offering the course. It is one part of the total course identifier number.

CourseSubjectAreaCode.description: This set of code values is derived from the first two digits of the CourseSCEDCode above.

CourseSupplementalAcademicGrade.description: Grades that are reported, which combine to make the final grade in a course.

CourseTitle.description: The name or title of the course taken by a student at an academic institution.

CourseUSISCode.description: The Statistics Canada University Student Information System (USIS) code to describe the area of study for the course.

items.description: Language associated with one or more aspects of the course
Learning outcomes from the course taken and learning experience
Topics to be taught in a course, learning experience or training
Licensure requirements satisfied by successful completion of this course
Additional information about the course

OriginalCourseID.description: The course ID as it was listed when the credit was earned (e.g. before a system conversion) to show consistency between present transcripts and older ones.

OverrideSchoolCourseNumber.description: The course ID as it was listed at the school where the credit was earned

items.description: Proficiency level signified by successful completion of this course
Curriculum requirements satisfied by successful completion of this course

UserDefinedExtensions.description: Additional structured information. Requires mutually defined XML schema.

AcRec:EmailType.description: Email address of source institution contact

EmailAddress.description: The numbers, letters, and symbols used to identify an electronic mail (Email) user within a network.

items.description: Additional information about the email address of the contact at the sending high school

AcRec:HighSchoolType.description: This is the secondary school  (high school) from which the person graduated or the last high school the party attended

ACT.description: The unique identifier assigned by the American College Testing or ACT for each postsecondary data exchange partner. See www.act.org.

ATP.description: The unique identifier assigned for the Admissions Testing Program by the College Board for each postsecondary data exchange partner.

CCD.description: The unique identifier assigned by the US Department of Education's National Center for Education Statistics as the Common Core of Data for each K12 data exchange partner.

CEEBACT.description: The unique identifier assigned by the College Entrance Examining Board and ACT for each K12 data exchange partner.

CSIS.description: The unique identifier assigned by the Statistics Canada Canadian College Student Information System for each postsecondary data exchange partner

DUNS.description: Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS), unique nine character company identification number issued by Dun and Bradstreet Corporation.

ESIS.description: The unique identifier assigned by the Statistics Canada Enhanced Student Information System for each postsecondary data exchange partner.

FICE.description: The unique identifier assigned for the Federal Interagency Committee on Education by the US Department of Education's National Center for Education Statistics for each postsecondary data exchange partner

GEOCode.description: The unique identifier assigned by PESC for educational institutions.

IPEDS.description: The unique identifier assigned by the National Center for Education Statistics for the Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System for each postsecondary data exchange partner.

MutuallyDefined.description: This code set could be used by prior agreement  among a set of trading partners.

NCHELPID.description: The unique identifier assigned by National Council on Higher Education Loan Programs for each data exchange partner.

OPEID.description: The unique identifier assigned by the Office of Postsecondary Education for each data exchange partner.

OrganizationName.description: Name of Non-person entity such as Organization, Institution, Agency or Business.

PSIS.description: The unique identifier assigned by the Statistics Canada Enhanced Student Information System for each data exchange partner.

PSS.description: The unique identifier assigned to private K12 schools in the US by the US Department of Education's National Center for Education Statistics (NCES)

USIS.description: The unique identifier assigned by the Statistics Canada University Student Information System for each postsecondary data exchange partner

LearningReflection.description: A learner's essay or statement about the extra- and co-curricular learning course taken or about the services experience.

items.description: The information of a person who coaches a learner during a service or an extra- and co-curricular experience learning program.
Additional information about a learning experience

PlacementLocation.description: The location where a learner studies or provides the services for the extra- and co-curricular experience learning program or courses.

SponsorOrganization.description: The department or organization that sponsors the extra- and co-curricular experience learning program or courses.

UserDefinedExtensions.description: Additional structured information. Requires mutually defined XML schema. Additional structured information.  Requires mutually defined XML schema.

AgencyAssignedID.description: The ID assigned by the state or province or an agency, to the person (student).

items.description: This complex data element is used to provide a student ID assigned by an agency, state, province, etc.
Any other names by which the student may be known

Birth.description: Identifying information related to a person's birth

items.description: Contact information for the student as recorded by the sending institution

HighSchool.description: This is the secondary school  (high school) from which the person graduated or the last high school the party attended.

items.description: Information about the student's ability to communicate in languages other than the primary language of the country where the sending school is located.

NSN.description: Canadian National Student Number Identifier Type

Name.description: The name of record of the student at the sending institution

items.description: Additional information about the person

PartialSSN.description: The last four digits of the person's U.S. Social Security Number

SIN.description: The person's Canadian Social Insurance Number

SSN.description: The person's U.S. Social Security Number

EffectiveDate.description: This the date when this phone information for the sending high school did or will become effective.

ExpirationDate.description: This the date when this phone information for the sending high school will no longer be valid.

items.description: Additional information about the phone number of the contact at the source institution

PhoneNumberExtension.description: The extended telephone addressing information used in addition to phone number such as a PBX extension, a pager PIN, or FAX sub-address

Country.description: Name of the country which the claimant states as the country of permanent residence

CountryCode.description: Code indicating Country. Use ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 standard.

County.description: Name of the county which the claimant states as the county of permanent residence

CountyCode.description: A code identifying the county which the applicant claims as the permanent residence. This is a 5-digit code which includes state (2 digits) and county within a state (3 digits).

AcRec:StudentType.description: Body of document. One segment per student

items.description: Information concerning the academic achievement or status of the student.
Additional information about the student

Person.description: Biographical and demographic information about the student.

items.description: Academic and achievement test data

UserDefinedExtensions.description: Additional structured information. Requires mutually defined XML schema.

CreatedDateTime.description: The Date and Time stamp when the document was created

Destination.description: This field is mandatory and essential to indicate the destination or recipient of the transcript being sent.

DocumentCompleteCode.description: This element indicates whether the document conveys a complete record. Partial documents may be produced for information that is recorded in multiple media or formats.  If the student is still enrolled at the school, but the record being sent includes all the available information to date for that student, then the record would be considered complete, and this data element would not be included in the transcript.  A value of Partial generally means that the remainder will be sent in hard copy.

DocumentID.description: The File Transmission Date and Time stamp with additional unique qualifying characters

DocumentOfficialCode.description: This element indicates if the document is unofficial. Unofficial documents may be produced for reference purpose but may not be binding.

DocumentProcessCode.description: This element indicates a TEST or PRODUCTION document

DocumentTypeCode.description: Type and purpose of document being transmitted

items.description: Additional information about transmission

RequestTrackingID.description: The unique ID associated with a request action that is returned to the requestor for document matching and tracking.

Source.description: This field is required and essential to indicate the source of the Transcript being sent.  It is normally the sending school where the student enrolled for courses.

UserDefinedExtensions.description: Additional structured information.  Requires mutually defined XML schema.

core:ACTType.description: The unique identifier for postsecondary educational institutions assigned by American College Testing available at www.act.org

core:ATPType.description: The unique identifier for the Admissions Testing Program assigned by the College Board for each data exchange partner.

core:AcademicAwardDateType.description: The date on which the academic award was conferred.

core:AcademicAwardLevelType.description: The level of the degree, certificate, or award granted for the successful completion of requirements of an academic program.B17 Did not complete secondary schoolB18 Standard High School Diploma which may or may not include an exit testB19 Advanced or honors diplomaB20 Vocational diplomaB21 Special Education Diploma normally for students with a disabilityB22 Certificate of completion or attendanceB23 Special certificate of completion or attendanceB24 General Education Development (GED) DiplomaB25 Other high school equivalency diplomaB26 International diploma or certificate such as International Baccalaureate B27 Standard High School Diploma with only 3 year curriculumB28 Met all graduation requirements except for required exit testFrenchBaccalaureate is an award made to high school students who complete a rigorous program of student including foreign languages.  It allows French and international students to obtain a standardized qualification, typically at the age of 18. This then qualifies holders to work in certain areas, or go on to tertiary education or acquire some other professional qualification or training.CEGEP is an award made by Canadian secondary schools that is typically equivalent to a high school diploma plus one year of college level courses

core:AcademicAwardTitleType.description: The descriptive title for the academic award.

core:AcademicCompletionDateType.description: The date on which the student's requirements for the degree or diploma were met or completed.

core:AcademicCompletionIndicatorType.description: An indication that the degree-seeking student completed all of the requirements for his or her academic program.  Not used for Non-Degree programs.

core:AcademicDegreeRequirementType.description: Thesis or dissertation information if required for the award.

items.description: Additional information about degree requirements

ThesisDissertationAdvisor.description: The advisor (Major Professor) supervising the Thesis or Dissertation on behalf of the student earning the degree.

ThesisDissertationTitle.description: The title of the thesis or dissertation.

URLAddress.description: The Uniform Resource Locator (URL) address of the sending high school or of a contact at the sending high school

core:AcademicHonorsType.description: Honors information for the academic award.

HonorsLevel.description: A code value representing 1st highest honor, 2nd highest and 3rd highest.

HonorsTitle.description: The descriptive title for the honors received.

items.description: Additional information about the academic honors

core:AcademicProgramNameType.description: Literal name of program, major, or field of study.

core:AcademicProgramType.description: Indicates whether the academic program is a major, minor, area of concentration or specialization.

AcademicProgramName.description: Literal name of program, major, or field of study.

AcademicProgramType.description: Indicates whether the academic program is a major, minor, area of concentration or specialization.

items.description: Additional information about the Academic Program

ProgramCIPCode.description: Code indicating a discipline or field of study assigned by the Classification of Instructional Programs for Postsecondary Institutions

ProgramCSISCode.description: Code indicating a discipline or field of study assigned by Statistics Canada Canadian College Student Information System

ProgramESISCode.description: Code indicating a discipline or field of study assigned by the Statistics Canada Enhanced Student Information System.

ProgramHEGISCode.description: Code indicating a discipline or field of study assigned by Higher Education General Information Survey

ProgramLocalCode.description: This is a code typically created and used within a school or school district

ProgramSecondarySchoolCode.description: Code indicating the type of secondary school program or award that a student is pursuing

ProgramUSISCode.description: Code indicating a discipline or field of study assigned by the Statistics Canada University Student Information System.

core:AcademicProgramTypeType.description: Indicates whether the academic program is a major, minor, area of concentration or specialization.

core:AcademicSessionDetailType.description: Information identifying the time period  for the beginning of this session

items.description: Additional information about the Academic Session

SessionBeginDate.description: Actual calendar date when session begins.

SessionDesignator.description: The academic session for which the data are recorded and applicable.

SessionDesignatorSuffix.description: A free form extension to the session ID to differentiate discreet sub-sessions within the same session

SessionEndDate.description: Actual calendar date when session ends.

SessionSchoolYear.description: This is the range of years that are considered to be a school year.

SessionType.description: Indicates the type of academic session at an educational institution.

core:AcademicSummaryTypeType.description: Summary Type is an indication of what is being summarized over which period of time.

core:AccreditationType.description: This complex data element provides information about the accreditation of the school sending the transcript.

AccreditingBodyCode.description: This is the acronym for the regional or other accrediting body that has given accreditation to the school sending the high school transcript

AccreditingBodyName.description: The name of the accrediting body.

items.description: Additional information about the accreditation of the sending high school

core:AdditionalStudentAchievementsType.description: Achievements not tied to a specific course, session or award.

items.description: Attributes of the Additional Student Achievement which may require special handling by the receiving institution

core:AddressEffectiveDateType.description: Not found in any education record schemas.  This is now used as EffectiveDate.  Not in CRC we use addressupdatedate  The effective date of the Address.

core:AddressExpirationDateType.description: The expiration date of the address.

core:AddressLineType.description: Local delivery information such as street, building number, PO box, or apartment portion of a postal address of a Contact at the Sending (Source) High School.

core:AddressType.description: This is a combined Address Group for a choice between Domestic or International

items.description: Local delivery information such as street, building number, PO box, or apartment portion of a postal address of a Contact at the Sending (Source) High School.
The individual or office name within the postal address where inquiries should be directed.

City.description: The city portion of the Address of a Contact at the Sending (Source) High School.

CountryCode.description: Code indicating Country. Use ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 standard.

EffectiveDate.description: This the date when this address for the sending high school did or will become effective.

ExpirationDate.description: This the date when this address for the sending high school will no longer be valid.

items.description: Additional information about the addresses of the contacts at the source  school

PostalCode.description: The postal code portion of the Address.

StateProvince.description: The literal name of the state, province or territory of a postal address of the source of this document. Use for addresses outside US or Canada.

core:AgeType.description: An integer that specifies how old a person is

core:AgencyAssignedIDType.description: The ID assigned by the state or province or an agency, to the person (student).

core:AgencyCodeType.description: A code that describes the type of agency that assigned the student's identification number

core:AgencyCourseIDType.description: The course ID that might have been assigned to this course by the state or other agency

core:AgencyIdentifierType.description: This complex data element is used to provide a student ID assigned by an agency, state, province, etc.

AgencyAssignedID.description: An identification number that has been assigned to the student by a state or province or other agency

AgencyCode.description: A code that describes the type of agency that assigned the student's identification number

AgencyName.description: The name of the state, province or agency that assigned the identification number to the student

CountryCode.description: The code that identifies the country in the world in which the agency that assigned the ID to the student is located.  .  Use ISO 3 155-1 alpha-2 standard.

items.description: Additional information about the identification number assigned by an agency

StateProvinceCode.description: The code that identifies the state or province in the US or Canada in which the agency that assigned the identification number to the student is located.

core:AgencyNameType.description: The name of the state, province or agency that assigned the identification number to the student

core:AlternateOutcomeFrameworkType.description: A container to hold the alternative framework taxonomies that map to the learning outcome

core:AttendanceCountType.description: Attendance recorded as days (or partial days) present or absent

DaysAbsent.description: The number of  days or partial days that the student did not attend classes this session

DaysPresent.description: The number of  days or partial days that the student attended classes this session

core:AttentionLineType.description: The individual or office name within the postal address where inquiries should be directed.

core:BirthCityType.description: The city in which the person was born.

core:BirthCountryCodeType.description: The name of the country in which the person was born.

core:BirthStateProvinceCodeType.description: The state, province, or extra-state jurisdiction in which the person was born

core:BirthType.description: Identifying information related to a person's birth

Age.description: An integer that specifies how old a person is

BirthCity.description: The city in which the person was born.

BirthCountry.description: The name of the country in which the person was born.  Use ISO 3 155-1 alpha-2 standard.

BirthStateProvinceCode.description: The state, province, or extra-state jurisdiction in which the person was born

items.description: Additional information about transcript

core:CCDType.description: The unique identifier assigned by National Center for Education Statistics as the Common Core of Data for each data exchange partner.

core:CEEBACTType.description: The unique identifier assigned by the College Entrance Examining Board and ACT for each K-12 data exchange partner.

core:CSISType.description: The unique identifier assigned by the Statistics Canada Canadian College Student Information System for each postsecondary data exchange partner.

core:CityType.description: The city portion of the Address of a Contact at the Sending (Source) High School.

core:ClassRankDateType.description: The date on which the student was included in the class ranking and the class was ranked

core:ClassRankSessionCountType.description: The number of sessions of coursework included in the ranking of the student in the class

core:ClassRankType.description: The student's class rank relative to other students in their academic cohort (e.g. class).

core:ClassRankYearMonthType.description: The year and month in which the student was included in the class ranking and the class was ranked

core:ClassRankYearType.description: The year on which the student was included in the class ranking and the class was ranked

core:ClassSizeType.description: The numeric size of the academic cohort (e.g. class).

core:CohortYearType.description: The school year in which the student entered the baseline group used for computing completion rates, e.g., high school year and program.

core:CompositeNameType.description: The full name of the person in Last NameSuffix, First Middle order; comma after last name or NameSuffix

core:ConditionsMetCodeType.description: Indicates whether and how conditions for the requirement have been attained.

core:CountryCodeType.description: Code indicating Country. Use ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 standard.

core:CountryType.description: Name of the country which the claimant states as the country of permanent residence

core:CountyCodeType.description: A code identifying the county which the applicant claims as the permanent residence. This is a 5-digit code which includes state (2 digits) and county within a state (3 digits).

core:CountyType.description: Name of the county which the claimant states as the county of permanent residence

core:CourseAcademicGradeScaleCodeType.description: The grading scale used by an academic educational institution for an academic course.

core:CourseAcademicGradeStatusCodeType.description: Special enrollment or completion status of this course

core:CourseAcademicGradeType.description: The final grade awarded for participation in the course.

core:CourseAddDateType.description: The date a student was added to an academic course at a school.

core:CourseApplicabilityType.description: The academic program to which this academic course applies toward graduation.

core:CourseBeginDateType.description: The official begin date for this course

core:CourseCIPCodeType.description: The Classification of Instructional Programs (CIP) code to describe the area of study for the course.

core:CourseCSISCodeType.description: The Statistics Canada Canadian College Student Information System (CCSIS) code to describe the area of study for the course.

core:CourseCreditBasisType.description: The type of enrollment associated with the credit hours for the course.

core:CourseCreditEarnedType.description: The number of credits a student earned by the successful completion of a course.

core:CourseCreditLevelType.description: The level of credit associated with the credit hours earned for the course.

core:CourseCreditUnitsType.description: The type of credits used at the high school

core:CourseCreditValueType.description: Number indicating the credit hours that may be earned in the course.

core:CourseDescriptionType.description: The text description describing the content of the course, as carried in the sending institution's course catalog.

core:CourseDropDateType.description: The date on which the student drops or withdraws from the course.

core:CourseEndDateType.description: The official end date for this course

core:CourseEquivalentAcademicGradeType.description: The alternate grade including the grade and its scale

EquivalentAcademicGrade.description: The grade earned for a course calculated under a different grade scale than the primary grade recorded

EquivalentGradeScaleCode.description: The alternative grade scale under which the related EquivalentAcademicGrade is calculated

core:CourseFiveDigitSCEDCodeType.description: This set of code values is derived from the first five digits of the CourseSCEDCode above.

core:CourseGPAApplicabilityCodeType.description: An indicator of whether or not this course being described is included in the computation of the student's Grade Point Average, and if so, if it weighted differently from regular courses.

core:CourseInstructionMethodType.description: The primary method of instruction used for the course.

core:CourseInstructionSiteNameType.description: The name of the location at which the course is taught.

core:CourseInstructionSiteType.description: An indication of the type of location at which the course is taught.

core:CourseInstructorType.description: The detailed information about the course instructor

Name.description: The name of record of the student at the sending institution

core:CourseLevelType.description: The level of work demonstrated by successful completion of  the academic course being described

core:CourseNCESCodeType.description: The code set developed (or being developed) by the United States Department of Education's National Center for Education Statistics for the Classification of Secondary School Courses

core:CourseNarrativeExplanationGradeType.description: The narrative of the grade awarded to a student in an academic course in those cases where a course does not receive a letter or numeric grade included in the grading scale of the Course Academic Grade Qualifier.

core:CourseNumberType.description: The official reference number portion of a course identifier. This number frequently designates the level of the course as well as the level of the student expected to enroll in the course

core:CourseQualityPointsEarnedType.description: The numerical value assigned to a letter grade to provide a basis of quantitative determination of an average.

core:CourseRepeatCodeType.description: Indicates that an academic course has been repeated by a student and how that repeat is to be computed in the student's academic grade average.

core:CourseSCEDCodeType.description: The School Codes for the Exchange of Data (SCED) code set being developed for the United States Department of Education's National Center for Education Statistics to describe the content and level of a course

core:CourseSectionNumberType.description: The number assigned to differentiate among distinct occurrences of courses that have the same course abbreviation and number but may be considered to be different .  For example, it could be used to identify the instructor.

core:CourseSubjectAbbreviationType.description: The alphabetic abbreviation of the academic department or discipline offering the course. It is one part of the total course identifier number.

core:CourseSubjectAreaCodeType.description: This set of code values is derived from the first two digits of the CourseSCEDCode above.

core:CourseTitleType.description: The name or title of the course taken by a student at an academic institution.

core:CourseUSISCodeType.description: The Statistics Canada University Student Information System (USIS) code to describe the area of study for the course.

core:CreatedDateTimeType.description: The Date and Time stamp when the document was created

core:CreditHoursAttemptedType.description: The total value of credit hours attempted whether or not included in the hours for GPA or hours earned.

core:CreditHoursDeficientType.description: The total value of credit hours the student is lacking in order to successfully complete requirements for an award, diploma or certificate.

core:CreditHoursEarnedType.description: The total value of credit hours successfully completed or earned.

core:CreditHoursRequiredType.description: The total value of credit hours that are required for the award or diploma for which the student is pursuing

core:CreditHoursforGPAType.description: The total value of credit hours used to calculate the Grade Point Average.

core:DUNSType.description: Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS), unique nine character company identification number issued by Dun and Bradstreet Corporation.

core:DaysAbsentType.description: The number of  days or partial days that the student did not attend classes this session

core:DaysPresentType.description: The number of  days or partial days that the student attended classes this session

items.description: Additional information about the deceased student

core:DelinquenciesType.description: The academic standing of the student upon transfer to the institution

core:DocumentCompleteCodeType.description: This element indicates whether the document conveys a complete record. Partial documents may be produced for information that is recorded in multiple media or formats.  If the student is still enrolled at the school, but the record being sent includes all the available information to date for that student, then the record would be considered complete, and this data element would not be included in the transcript.  A value of Partial generally means that the remainder will be sent in hard copy.

core:DocumentIDType.description: The File Transmission Date and Time stamp with additional unique qualifying characters

core:DocumentOfficialCodeType.description: This element indicates if the document is unofficial. Unofficial documents may be produced for reference purpose but may not be binding.

core:DocumentProcessCodeType.description: This element indicates a TEST or PRODUCTION document

core:DocumentTypeCodeType.description: Type and purpose of document being transmitted

core:ESISType.description: The unique identifier assigned by the Statistics Canada Enhanced Student Information System for each data postsecondary exchange partner.

core:EducationSubtestCodeType.description: Code identifying the sub-part of a standardized test (e.g. Quantitative, Verbal).  These codes are the newer codes used in the XML Education Test Score Reporting and the Application for Admission schemas.  They are tied to each individual test.

core:EducationTestCodeType.description: Code identifying the test in the newer XML version of Test Codes

core:EmailAddressType.description: The numbers, letters, and symbols used to identify an electronic mail (Email) user within a network.

core:EmailType.description: Email address of source institution contact

EmailAddress.description: The numbers, letters, and symbols used to identify an electronic mail (Email) user within a network.

items.description: Additional information about the email address of the contact at the sending high school

core:EndorseType.description: Info of a Person who endorses a diploma, a program or a certificate

PositionTitle.description: Job title or position of the contact at the endorsing organization

core:EntryDateType.description: The date on which the student officially was admitted to the school or when the student first attended the school.

core:ExitDateType.description: The date on which the student officially withdrew, was withdrawn, or graduated.

core:ExitReasonCodeType.description: The reason the student stopped attending.  It is a code set approved by the US Department of Education's National Center for Education Statistics and is included in the NCES Handbook.

core:FICEType.description: The unique identifier once maintained for the Federal Interagency Committee on Education by the National Center for Education Statistics for each postsecondary data exchange partner.

core:FirstNameType.description: The first name of the person, usually given at birth, baptism, or during, another ceremony, or through legal change

core:ScoreInvalidatedIndicatorType.description: Indicates if the score has been invalidated.  If true, score previously reported for this test and test date is not valid.

core:ScoreRevisedIndicatorType.description: Indicates if the score report has been revised.  If true, score may differ from score previously reported for this test and test date.

core:ScoreSelfreportedIndicatorType.description: Indicates if the score has been self-reported by the student.

core:ScoreValueType.description: The actual value of the score received on the test

core:StateProvinceCodeType.description: Code for US states, etc., and Canadian provinces.
